title: Cluster of cluster — Cluster_of_cluster
code: Cluster_of_cluster(   mRNAexp,   miRNAexp,   lncRNAexp,   methylation,   maxK = 6,   reps = 50,   pItem = 0.8,   pFeature = 1,   clusterAlg = "hc",   distance = "pearson",   innerLinkage = "complete",   seed = 1262118388.71279,   plot = "pdf" )

title: Cluster of cluster — Cluster_of_cluster
text: mRNAexp matrix mRNA expression miRNAexp matrix miRNA expression lncRNAexp matrix lncRNA expression maxK integer value. maximum cluster number  Consensus Clustering Algorithm evaluate. reps integer value. number subsamples(words, iteration number cluster number) pItem Please refer "ConsensusClusterPlus" package detailed information. pFeature Please refer "ConsensusClusterPlus" package detailed information. clusterAlg character value. cluster algorithm. 'hc' heirarchical (hclust), 'pam' paritioning around medoids, 'km' k-means upon data matrix, 'kmdist' k-means upon distance matrices (former km option), function returns clustering. distance character value. 'pearson': (1 - Pearson correlation), 'spearman' (1 - Spearman correlation), 'euclidean', 'binary', 'maximum', 'canberra', 'minkowski" custom distance function. innerLinkage Please refer "ConsensusClusterPlus" package detailed information. seed optional numerical value. sets random seed reproducible results. plot Please refer "ConsensusClusterPlus" package detailed information.

title: Cluster of cluster — Cluster_of_cluster
text: list length maxK. element list containing consensusMatrix (numerical matrix), consensusTree (hclust), consensusClass (consensus class asssignments).

title: Cluster of cluster — Cluster_of_cluster
code: data(mRNAexp) data(miRNAexp) data(lncRNAexp) data(methylation) mRNAexp=data.filter(mRNAexp,percentage=0.6) miRNAexp=data.filter(miRNAexp,percentage=0.6) lncRNAexp=data.filter(lncRNAexp,percentage=0.6) mRNAexp[mRNAexp==0]<-NA miRNAexp[miRNAexp==0]<-NA lncRNAexp[lncRNAexp==0]<-NA mRNAexp<-as.matrix(mRNAexp) miRNAexp<-as.matrix(miRNAexp) lncRNAexp<-as.matrix(lncRNAexp) mRNAexp=data.imputation(mRNAexp,fun="knn") miRNAexp=data.imputation(miRNAexp,fun="knn") lncRNAexp=data.imputation(lncRNAexp,fun="knn") results = Cluster_of_cluster(mRNAexp,miRNAexp,lncRNAexp,methylation,maxK=6,reps=50,pItem=0.8,pFeature=1,clusterAlg="hc",distance="pearson",innerLinkage="complete",seed=1262118388.71279,plot="pdf") #> end fraction #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> end fraction #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> end fraction #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> end fraction #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> end fraction #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered #> clustered

title: Data filter — data.filter
text: Data matrix representing genomic data gene expression data, miRNA expression data.  matrix, rows represent genomic features, columns represent samples. percentage maximum proportion sample missing values

title: Data filter — data.filter
code: Data=matrix(runif(1000),nrow = 50,ncol = 20) geneName=paste("Gene", 1:50, sep = " ") sampleName=paste("Sample", 1:20, sep = " ") rownames(Data)=geneName colnames(Data)=sampleName index=sample(c(1:1000),300) Data[index]=NA result=data.filter(Data,percentage=0.6)

title: Data imputation — data.imputation
text: Data matrix representing genomic data gene expression data, miRNA expression data.  matrix, rows represent genomic features, columns represent samples. fun character value representing imputation type. optional values shown : "median". NAs replaced median existing values feature samples. "mean". NAs replaced mean existing values feature samples. "knn". apply "impute" package impute missing values. common way process missing observation MicroArray dataset(Default value).

title: Data imputation — data.imputation
text: Xu T, Le TD, Liu L, Su N, Wang R, Sun B, Colaprico , Bontempi G, Li J. CancerSubtypes: R/Bioconductor package molecular cancer subtype identification, validation visualization. Bioinformatics. 2017 Oct 1;33(19):3131-3133. doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btx378. PMID: 28605519.

title: Data imputation — data.imputation
code: Data=matrix(runif(1000),nrow = 50,ncol = 20) geneName=paste("Gene", 1:50, sep = " ") sampleName=paste("Sample", 1:20, sep = " ") rownames(Data)=geneName colnames(Data)=sampleName index=sample(c(1:1000),60) Data[index]=NA result=data.imputation(Data,fun="knn")

title: Data normalization — data.normalization
text: Data matrix representing genomic data gene expression data, miRNA expression data.  matrix, rows represent genomic features, columns represent samples. type character value representing normalization type. optional values shown : "feature_Median". default value. Normalize dataset sweeping median values feature. "feature_Mean". Normalize dataset sweeping mean values feature. "feature_zscore". Conduct z_score normalization feature. "sample_zscore".  Conduct z_score normalization samples. log2 logical value. TRUE, data transform log2(x+1). commonly used RNAseq data.

title: Data normalization — data.normalization
text: Xu T, Le TD, Liu L, Su N, Wang R, Sun B, Colaprico , Bontempi G, Li J. CancerSubtypes: R/Bioconductor package molecular cancer subtype identification, validation visualization. Bioinformatics. 2017 Oct 1;33(19):3131-3133. doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btx378. PMID: 28605519.

title: Dif.limma — Dif.limma
text: Differently Expression Analysis genomic data. apply limma package conduct analysis.

title: Dif.limma — Dif.limma
code: Dif.limma(   Tumor_Data,   Normal_Data,   group = NULL,   topk = NULL,   sort.by = "p",   adjust.method = "BH",   RNAseq = FALSE )

title: Dif.limma — Dif.limma
text: Tumor_Data matrix representing genomic data cancer samples gene expression data, miRNA expression data. matrix, rows represent genomic features, columns represent cancer samples. Normal_Data matrix representing genomic data Normal samples. matrix, rows represent genomic features corresponding Tumor_Data, columns represent normal samples. group vector representing subtype tumor sample Tumor_Data. length group equal column number Tumor_Data. topk top number different expression features want extract return result. sort.parmeter "topTable() limma pacakge". "Character string specifying statistic rank genes . Possible values topTable toptable "logFC", "AveExpr", "t", "P", "p", "B" "none". (Permitted synonyms "M" "logFC", "" "Amean" "AveExpr", "T" "t" "p" "P".) Possibilities topTableF "F" "none". Possibilities topTreat topTable except "B"." adjust.method parmeter "topTable() limma pacakge".  Refer "method used adjust p-values multiple testing. Options, increasing conservatism, include "none", "BH", "" "holm". See p.adjust complete list options. NULL value result default adjustment method, "BH"." RNAseq bool type representing input datatype RNASeq . Default FALSE microarray data.

title: Dif.limma — Dif.limma
text: list representing differently expression subtype comparing Normal group.

title: Quantile Normalize By Feature — quantileNormalizeByFeature
text: cross-platform normalization method using FSQN improve comparability DNA microarray RNA-seq datasets

title: Quantile Normalize By Feature — quantileNormalizeByFeature
text: matrix_to_normalize matrix (m x n) m samples rows, n features columns. target_distribution_matrix matrix (m2 x n) m2 samples rows, n features columns use target distribution.

title: Quantile Normalize By Feature — quantileNormalizeByFeature
text: Franks JM, Cai G, Whitfield ML. Feature specific quantile normalization enables cross-platform classification molecular subtypes using gene expression data. Bioinformatics. 2018 Jun 1;34(11):1868-1874. doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/bty026. PMID: 29360996; PMCID: PMC5972664.

title: Quantile Normalize By Feature — quantileNormalizeByFeature
code: set.seed(7) target <- matrix(rnorm(100*150, mean = 1, sd = 1), nrow = 100, ncol = 150) test <- matrix(rnorm(30*150, mean = 2, sd = 2), nrow = 30, ncol = 150) normalized_test <- quantileNormalizeByFeature(test, target)

what: Dataset: The results of cluster — results
title: Dataset: The results of cluster — results
Dataset: The results of cluster — results
Dataset: The results of cluster — results
Surplot — Surplot
text: results results clustering meta clinical data downloaded TCGA optK optimal K

title: Surplot — Surplot
code: data(results) data(meta) maxK = 6 Kvec = 2:maxK x1 = 0.1; x2 = 0.9 # threshold defining the intermediate sub-interval PAC = rep(NA,length(Kvec)) names(PAC) = paste("K=",Kvec,sep="") # from 2 to maxK for(i in Kvec){  M = results[[i]]$consensusMatrix  Fn = ecdf(M[lower.tri(M)])  PAC[i-1] = Fn(x2) - Fn(x1) } optK = Kvec[which.min(PAC)] Surplot(results,meta,optK=3)
